exceptions.exn: In environment m : forall A : Set, Map A -> Map bool A : Set x : Map A Unable to unify "prechain_dom_ok ?M1907 ?M1909 (single ?M1907 ?M1908)" with "(fix domain_equal (A B : Set) (m0 : Map A) (m1 : Map B) {struct m1} : Prop := match m0 with | @M0 _ => match m1 with | @M0 _ => True | _ => False end | @M1 _ a _ => match m1 with | @M1 _ b _ => a = b | _ => False end | @M2 _ a b => match m1 with | @M2 _ c d => domain_equal A B a c /\\ domain_equal A B b d | _ => False end end) A bool x (m A x)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (A : Set) (x : Map A), ensemble_base A x (map_mini A x)

Premises:
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally
ensemble_base : forall A : Set, Map A -> Map bool -> Prop
map_mini : forall A : Set, Map A -> Map bool
Inductive Map (A : Type) : Type := M0 : Map A | M1 : ad -> A -> Map A | M2 : Map A -> Map A -> Map A For Map: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M0: Argument scope is [type_scope] For M1: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For M2: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
non_dist_concat_s : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A), non_dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) x)
dist_concat_s : forall (A : Set) (x y : Map A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) y)
domok_single : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T (single A x)
dist_compl_6 : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (z : prechain A), ~ dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) x)
prechain_sum : forall (A : Set) (p : prechain A), (exists x : Map A, p = single A x) \/ (exists (x : Map A) (y : prechain A), p = concat A y x)
incr_single : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A), prechain_incr A r (single A x)
domok_concat : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (p : prechain A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T p -> prechain_dom_ok A T (concat A p x)
iteres_incr : forall (A : Set) (r : mRelation A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), r x (f x) -> increasing_app A r f -> prechain_incr A r (iteres A f x n)
incr_concat : forall (A : Set) (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), r (prechain_last A p) x -> prechain_incr A r p -> prechain_incr A r (concat A p x)
Inductive non_dist_chain (A : Set) : prechain A -> Prop := non_dist_concat_s : forall x : Map A, non_dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) x) | non_dist_concat_m_hd : forall (x : Map A) (z : prechain A), non_dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) x) | non_dist_concat_m_tl : forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), non_dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> non_dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) y) For non_dist_chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For non_dist_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For non_dist_concat_m_hd: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For non_dist_concat_m_tl: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
Inductive dist_chain (A : Set) : prechain A -> Prop := dist_single : forall x : Map A, dist_chain A (single A x) | dist_concat_s : forall x y : Map A, x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A (single A x) y) | dist_concat_m : forall (x y : Map A) (z : prechain A), x <> y -> dist_chain A (concat A z x) -> dist_chain A (concat A (concat A z x) y) For dist_chain: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _] For dist_concat_s: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For dist_concat_m: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _]
iteres_dom_ok : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> prechain_dom_ok A T (iteres A f x n)
Inductive prechain_dom_ok (A : Set) : mEnsemble A -> prechain A -> Prop := domok_single : forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T (single A x) | domok_concat : forall (x : Map A) (T : mEnsemble A) (p : prechain A), T x -> prechain_dom_ok A T p -> prechain_dom_ok A T (concat A p x) For prechain_dom_ok: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For domok_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _] For domok_concat: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _]
iteres_non_sas_chain_fp_2 : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n m : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> increasing_app A r f -> r x (f x) -> bounded_sas_chain A T r m -> m <= n -> fix_point A T f (power (Map A) f x n)
MapFlag_sum : forall (A : Set) (f : MapFlag A), exists x : Map A, f = flag_true A x \/ f = flag_false A x
iteres_last : forall (A : Set) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat) (y : prechain A) (z : Map A), iteres A f x n = concat A y z -> z = f (prechain_last A y)
Inductive prechain_incr (A : Set) : mRelation A -> prechain A -> Prop := incr_single : forall (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A), prechain_incr A r (single A x) | incr_concat : forall (x : Map A) (r : mRelation A) (p : prechain A), r (prechain_last A p) x -> prechain_incr A r p -> prechain_incr A r (concat A p x) For prechain_incr: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For incr_single: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _] For incr_concat: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _ _]
iteres_non_sas_chain_fp_0 : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (r : mRelation A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n m : nat), T x -> def_ok_app A T f -> increasing_app A r f -> r x (f x) -> bounded_sas_chain A T r m -> m <= n -> exists p : nat, S p <= n /\ power (Map A) f x p = power (Map A) f x (S p)
iteres_def_ok : forall (A : Set) (T : mEnsemble A) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n k : nat), def_ok_app A T f -> T (power (Map A) f x n) -> T (power (Map A) f x (n + k))
domain_equal_mapget : forall (A B : Set) (m0 : Map A) (m1 : Map B) (a : ad) (x : A), domain_equal A B m0 m1 -> MapGet A m0 a = Some x -> exists y : B, MapGet B m1 a = Some y
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
dist_compl_1 : forall (A : Set) (m : Map A), dist_compl_def_1 A (single A m)
domain_equal_reflexive : forall (A : Set) (m : Map A), domain_equal A A m m
lazy_power_eg_power_0 : forall (A : Set) (egalite : Map A -> Map A -> bool) (f : Map A -> Map A) (x : Map A) (n : nat), (forall a b : Map A, egalite a b = true <-> a = b) -> forall z : Map A, (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_true A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n /\ z = f z) /\ (lazy_power_aux A egalite f x n = flag_false A z -> z = power (Map A) f x n)

```coq
intros A x.
unfold ensemble_base.
exists (map_mini A x).
apply domok_single.
reflexivity.
Qed.```

original: intros A x. unfold ensemble_base. exists (map_mini A x). apply domok_single. reflexivity.
